physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was still febrile upon admission to the trauma unit.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 3 days, the clinical situation improved substantially, with fever subsiding and significant wound improvement noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At admission, the patient had a severe infection with wet gangrene of the stump.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, local inflammation rapidly decreased, and by 1 week, signs of infection were subsiding with granulation tissue forming.
